pullrequest.title: Call PhysicsEngine::SetParam in child physics engines

content.raw:
I've started using cppcheck 1.67 from a PPA made by @\_jrivero_ and it has a few complaints about variable scope. These are also checked by the [drone.io CI job](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/5415):
~~~
[gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:117]: (style) The scope of the variable 'maxStepSize' can be reduced.
[gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:118]: (style) The scope of the variable 'realTimeUpdateRate' can be reduced.
[gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:119]: (style) The scope of the variable 'realTimeFactor' can be reduced.
~~~

If those are too nit-picky I can tell the drone.io job to ignore them. What do you think?
content.html:
I've started using cppcheck 1.67 from a PPA made by @_jrivero_ and it has a few complaints about variable scope. These are also checked by the drone.io CI job:

[gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:117]: (style) The scope of the variable 'maxStepSize' can be reduced.
[gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:118]: (style) The scope of the variable 'realTimeUpdateRate' can be reduced.
[gazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine_TEST.cc:119]: (style) The scope of the variable 'realTimeFactor' can be reduced.

If those are too nit-picky I can tell the drone.io job to ignore them. What do you think?
